results.title: Electric Vehicles - Worldwide | Statista Market Forecast
results.content: In 2025, the revenue in the Electric Vehicles market is projected to reach a staggering US$993.0bn worldwide.

results.title: Q2 EV Sales Dip During Record First Half - Cox Automotive
results.content: According to the latest report from Cox Automotive‚Äôs Kelley Blue Book team, sales of new electric vehicles (EVs) in the second quarter of 2025 were lower year over year by 6.3%, in line with the Cox Automotive forecast. Sales in Q2 were higher than in Q1 by 4.9%, and total EV sales through the first half of 2025 set a record at 607,089, representing a 1.5% year-over-year increase. The EV pioneer‚Äôs share of total U.S. sales (3.4%) and share of the EV market (44.7%) have both declined year-to-date in 2025. In the U.S. market, the used EV market is now the shiny new thing ‚Äì retail used EV sales surpassed 100,000 units in Q2, a record, and growth is accelerating.

results.title: The Global Electric Vehicle Market In 2025 - Virta
results.content: **In this guide, we serve you the latest facts, figures, and forecasts about the electric vehicle and EV charging market and its predicted growth for 2026 and beyond.** However, as time showed, 2020 turned out to be a surprisingly positive year, with global **EV sales** **growing by 43% from 2019** and the global electric car industry market share rising to a record 4,6%. However, the more electric vehicles roaming the roads, the more public charge¬†points¬†are¬†needed¬†to support the wide EV uptake, especially in dense areas where access to home charging is more limited. Shifting from incentivising the sales of electric cars to supporting heavy-duty transportation and the rollout of EV charging infrastructure is a common phenomenon in¬†mature EV markets.

results.title: 53% EV Share in China! ‚Äî June 2025 Sales Report - CleanTechnica
results.content: Looking at the rest of the best seller table, the highlights come mostly from the BYD stable, with the #9 BYD Seal 06, the BYD Qin L sibling from the Ocean series, hitting a year-best score of 21,770 units, just like the #11 BYD Song L *(you guessed it, the Next Generation BYD Song)*, which had its best score in 2025, 19,298 units, which, let‚Äôs face it, after a year and a half on the market, is a bit underwhelming, especially considering its predecessor in the Song dynasty is still selling double its volume. Looking at the 2025 ranking, the main highlights were the changes between the 3rd and 7th spots, with the Wuling Mini losing its podium status to the BYD Seagull while the Tesla Model Y took profit from June‚Äôs peak to jump two positions, into 4th.

results.title: The best-selling EVs in China during the first half of 2025 - Autovista24
results.content: [![Image 11: Electric vehicle recharging outdoor technology renewable energy.](https://autovista24.autovistagroup.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/5/2025/10/europe-evv-16-10-25-1024x683.jpg) Tech #### Can Tesla keep its unparalleled lead in Europe‚Äôs EV market? After exceptional growth in [February](https://autovista24.autovistagroup.com/news/outstanding-bev-performance-in-china-despite-tesla-tailspin/), [March](https://autovista24.autovistagroup.com/news/sensational-finish-to-chinas-ev-markets-in-the-first-quarter/) and April, improvements were more relaxed in May. June saw an improvement of 39% compared to last year, as 687,277 units were sold in the country. Meanwhile, the PHEV market returned to an upward growth trend following a wobble in May. The market increased by 36.1% between [January](https://autovista24.autovistagroup.com/news/has-byd-and-telsas-strong-hold-on-china-weakened/) and June, with 2,460,588 units taking to Chinese roads. In ninth was the Changan Lumin, with its highest monthly sales figure since [November 2024](https://autovista24.autovistagroup.com/news/byd-dominates-chinas-phev-market-during-november).

results.title: European Battery Electric Vehicle Market Surges 34% in First Half of ...
results.content: The first half of 2025 marked a significant milestone for the European battery electric vehicle (BEV) market, with new registrations up 34% compared to the same period in 2024. Battery electric vehicles (BEVs) remain the primary driver of growth in the European alternative fuels market. PHEVs continued to represent a significant share of new registrations in certain markets, though their year-on-year growth rate was lower than that of BEVs, further emphasizing the market‚Äôs pivot toward fully electric solutions. The European market recorded a steady increase in monthly registrations of battery electric vehicles (BEV) and plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEV) during the first half of 2025. The chart below demonstrates the monthly evolution of market share for each major alternative fuel type (BEV, PHEV, hydrogen, LPG, CNG, LNG) for M1 (car) registrations in Europe:

results.title: Europe's electric vehicle market leaders: Denmark, Sweden, and ...
results.content: This market spotlight focuses on the electric vehicle (EV) markets in Denmark, Sweden, and Finland, which rank among the leaders in Europe in terms of EV shares of new passenger car registrations. Nordic countries are leading Europe‚Äôs transition to EVs. Norway is the region‚Äôs top market in terms of EV share of new passenger car registrations: Between January and May 2025, battery electric vehicles (BEVs) and plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEVs) made up 96% of Norway‚Äôs new passenger car registrations. In the first five months of 2025, EVs accounted for 60% of new passenger car registrations in Sweden; among new passenger car registrations, 34% were BEVs and 26% were PHEVs. Compared with the same period in 2024, BEV registrations increased by 18% and PHEVs by 15%, and the total passenger car market grew by 6%.

results.title: Korean Vehicles Market - Facts & Data 2025 - Focus2Move
results.content: Brand-wise, **Hyundai** remained leader with a 35.5% share (+7.5%), followed by **Kia** in 2nd (+1.9%). **South Korea‚Äôs EV sector is expanding in 2025,** despite sluggish performance in Q1. South Korea‚Äôs automotive industry remained closed to foreign imports until 2012. The entry of new competitors drove market growth, peaking at 1.82 million sales in 2016. The market then remained steady until 2020 when COVID-19 incentives pushed sales up 5.8% to a record 1.87 million units. Despite high EV prices, slow adoption, and supply chain issues, the market rebounded in 2023, growing 3.2% to 1.72 million units, only to fall again by 5.7% in 2024 to 1.6 million. results.title: Federal Funding for Zero-Emission Energy and Transportation
results.content: This includes Joint Office-led funding programs like Ride and Drive Electric and Communities Taking Charge funding opportunity announcements, ongoing electric vehicle (EV) research and analysis projects and grants, and other funding opportunities through partner government agencies. Managed by the U.S. Department of Transportation Federal Highway Administration (FHWA) and supported by the Joint Office, the $5 billion NEVI Formula Program provides dedicated funding to states to strategically deploy EV charging infrastructure and establish an interconnected network to facilitate data collection, access, and reliability. Led by the U.S. Department of Energy Vehicle Technologies Office, this funding program aims to advance replicable solutions to support electrified medium- and heavy-duty vehicles, accelerate charging infrastructure deployment, and reduce grid impacts through vehicle-grid integration strategies.

results.title: Overview of EV Federal Funding and Financing Programs
results.content: Overview of EV Federal Funding and Financing Programs | US Department of Transportation Federal funding for electric vehicle infrastructure can be drawn from several sources, including competitive and formula grant programs, loan financing programs, and tax incentives. Three agencies administer most Federal funding programs applicable to rural EV infrastructure: the U.S. Department of Transportation, the U.S. Department of Agriculture, and the Department of Energy. Its relevant funding programs focus on reducing emissions from road vehicles and increasing access to EV infrastructure. FHWA is also responsible for administering formula and competitive grant programs for EV charging infrastructure established under the 2021 Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. FHWA can also provide project-specific financing techniques and tools through its Center for Innovative Finance Support. Relevant funding programs enable small businesses to conduct technology research related to EV infrastructure.

results.title: Electric Vehicle Regulations and Laws: A Primer for Decision Makers
results.content: To reduce emissions, ACT requires original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) of medium-duty and heavy-duty (HD) vehicles to sell zero-emissions vehicles (ZEVs) or near-zero-emissions vehicles (NZEVs) such as plug-in electric hybrids as an increasing percentage of their annual sales from 2024 to 2035. ACF is designed to complement the Advanced Clean Trucks (ACT) rule and requires fleets to adopt an increasing percentage of zero-emissions vehicles (ZEVs) such as battery electric, long-range plug-in electric hybrids, and hydrogen fuel cell MDHD trucks. This proposed regulation from the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) would reduce passenger car, light truck, and MD vehicle emissions of CO2, hydrocarbons, nitrogen oxides, and particulate matter.

According to Audrey LaForest from Automotive News, the EPA ‚Äúalleviated some of the pressure by giving automakers a longer runway to ramp up electric vehicle production and sales and by adding more flexibility for compliance by factoring in plug-in hybrids and other technologies.‚Äù Still, manufacturers will need to scale up production capacity of zero-emission vehicles considerably to meet the targets of this new rule.

results.title: What to Expect in the Electric Vehicle Industry: EV Trends For 2025
results.content: One of the most significant EV trends in 2025 is the rapid expansion of charging infrastructure, addressing a key barrier to electric vehicle adoption. Another transformative electric vehicle trend is the rise of bidirectional charging stations (V2G), which allow EVs to draw power from the grid and supply energy back to it. Installers must stay updated on the latest electric vehicle trends to effectively install and maintain EV charging station infrastructure. This EV trend towards sustainable transportation is motivated by various factors, including heightened environmental concerns and the imperative to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, widespread governmental incentives and policies supporting EV adoption, continuous advancements in battery technology resulting in longer driving ranges and the decreasing costs of electric vehicles.

results.title: 2025 EV Sales Data Insights: Trends Transforming Electric Growth
results.content: # 2025 EV Sales Data Insights: Trends Transforming Electric Growth In this post, you will learn about the overall EV sales data landscape, quarterly sales performance, and the key growth drivers shaping the market. As you reviewed the sales overview, quarterly performance, key growth drivers, regional insights, historical trends, and the impact of data tools, you became better equipped to understand the dynamic nature of the market. A: Historical data shows a steady rise from less than 1% market share to robust growth, with projections suggesting up to 14 million EV sales globally in the next decade. A: It provides interactive data on quarterly sales trends, market share increases, and comparisons between plug-in, hybrid and fully electric models.
